meanings.definition: The final stage of a game, typically involving strategic moves to secure victory.
meanings.sent1: In the endgames of chess, players carefully plan their moves to win.
meanings.sent2: During the endgames of a soccer match, teams give their all to score the winning goal.
meanings.sent3: The endgames of a board game can get intense as players try to outsmart each other.
meanings.sent4: Life's challenges can be seen as endgames where we must make strategic decisions to succeed.
meanings.sent5: The endgames of a puzzle require careful thinking to complete the final steps.

meanings.definition: The ultimate goal or outcome of a situation or process.
meanings.sent1: His endgames in business were always focused on achieving maximum profit.
meanings.sent2: The endgames of a project often determine its overall success.
meanings.sent3: Reaching the endgames of a marathon is a satisfying accomplishment.
meanings.sent4: In life, happiness can be considered the endgames we all strive for.
meanings.sent5: The endgames of a journey are as important as the beginning.

meanings.definition: The concluding part of a play, movie, or narrative.
meanings.sent1: The endgames of the movie revealed the fate of the main characters.
meanings.sent2: In the endgames of the play, all loose ends were tied up.
meanings.sent3: The endgames of the story left the audience in suspense.
meanings.sent4: The endgames of the novel brought a surprising twist to the plot.
meanings.sent5: The endgames of the TV series left viewers eager for the next season.
